div.l: And knewe the estres bet than did this Iohn
And by the wal a staf she fond a non
And saugh a litel shemeryng of a light
For at an hole in shoon the mone bright
And by the light she saught hem bothe two
But sikerly she nyste who was who
But as she saw a white thyng in hir eye
And whan she gan this white thyng espie
She wende the clerk hadde wered a voluper
And with the staf she drowe ay ner and ner
And wende han hit this Aleyn̄ atte fulle
And smot the Millere on the piled sculle
That doun̄ he gooth and cride harrowe y dye
Thise clerkes bette hym wel and leet hym lye
And grethen hem and took hir hors a non
And eke hir mele and on hir wey thei gon
And at the Mille yit thei toke hir cake
Of half a busshel flour͗e ful wel y bake
Thus is the prowde Millere wel y bete
And hath y loste the gryndyng of his whete
And paid for the soper eủerydel
Of Aleyn and of Iohn that that bette hym wel
Is wif ys swyued and his doghter als
Lo whiche it is a Millere to be fals
And therfore this ꝓprouerbe is seide ful sooth
Hym thar nat wene wel that yuel dooth
A Gyler shal hym self bigiled bee
And god that sitheth heye in magestee
Saue al this Compaynye greet and smale
Thus haue y quyted the Millere in my tale
div.fw: hure host saugh wel that th
